text:
Demi the matchmaker!

Last night, the "Confident" singer and her fans were moved to tears as two of her friends got engaged onstage at her concert at The Forum in Inglewood, California .

During her concert, Lovato invited American Idol alum Rayvon Owen onstage, where he was surprised by his partner and Lovato's other friend Shane Bitney Crone who entered via a trap door onstage. Crone then took Owen's hand as he got down on one knee and proposed. Lovato watched the romantic moment from the side of the stage. Excitingly, Owen said yes, and the two shared an adorable kiss as the audience cheered.

"Yay!" Lovato said, as she ran back onstage to rejoin them.

"What some of you don't know is that these are two of my really close friends and I've gotten to watch Shane go through so much and come out on the other side...such a strong person who's now found the love of his life," she said as she teared up.

"I'm so happy guys," she added. "I'm so f--king happy."

Watch the sweet moment here:

After the sweet proposal, Demi sang "Yes" for the audience, and the newly-couple sat onstage as a video montage of their love story was screened. Demi's supporting act, DJ Khaled surprised fans during his set by bringing out special guests including Diddy, Tinashe, Jaden Smith, Chris Brown, and Fergie .

See more: Demi Lovato Is Walking Down the Aisle in a Lazaro Wedding Dress

Lovato has also made the news for her love life recently, as rumors of her dating her ex, Wilmer Valderrama have made their way across the internet.

A source revealed to E! News , "They could definitely end up back together," the source says of the famous duo. "They have crazy love for one another and a very special place in each other's hearts. When you have history like theirs, things are so comfortable and familiar. Nothing can really compare."

Sounds like she's not Sorry Not Sorry anymore.
